metadata.Title: CVE-2020-16093 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium.
metadata.Description:
In LemonLDAP::NG (aka lemonldap-ng) through 2.0.8, validity of the X.509 certificate is not checked by default when connecting to remote LDAP backends, because the default configuration of the Net::LDAPS module for Perl is used.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-16093` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

lemonldap-ng - 2.0.9+ds-1
lemonldap-ng-fastcgi-server - 2.0.9+ds-1
lemonldap-ng-handler - 2.0.9+ds-1
lemonldap-ng-uwsgi-app - 2.0.9+ds-1
liblemonldap-ng-common-perl - 2.0.9+ds-1
liblemonldap-ng-handler-perl - 2.0.9+ds-1
liblemonldap-ng-manager-perl - 2.0.9+ds-1
liblemonldap-ng-portal-perl - 2.0.9+ds-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: lemonldap-ng package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.0.9+ds-1').
